main event: Several civilian witnesses observed a bright, white, globular-shaped object that remained stationary for a while, then suddenly accelerated and flew out of sight at a very high speed near Wink, Texas on August 13, 1952.
interesting points: The object emitted an intense brilliant light.
The investigation revealed that the object was not an aircraft, satellite, or any other known object.
Two indistinct flying objects were observed approximately 13 miles west of Wink, Texas, which changed direction and seemed to be at an altitude of approximately 6000 to 8000 feet.
The objects were unidentified in both the telescope and the naked eye.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
